description: Triangle T00, T10, T01, T20, T11, T02, etc., where Tmn = number of distinct products ij with min(m,n) <= i,j <= max(m,n).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of table, flattened
mathematica: t[m_, n_] := i*j /. {ToRules @ Reduce[ Min[m, n] <= i <= j <= Max[m, n], Integers]} // Union // Length; row[n_] := Table[ t[m, n-m], {m, 0, n} ]; Table[ row[n], {n, 0, 11}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 16 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (nub)a027420 n k = a027420_tabl !! n !! ka027420_row n = a027420_tabl !! na027420_tabl = zipWith (zipWith z) a002262_tabl a025581_tabl               where z u v = length $ nub $ [i * j | i <- zs, j <- zs]                             where zs = [min u v .. max u v]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 02 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
